page.title: 18FARMING ECOLOGY DARTMOOR
page.content: At {Southbrook Farm}a dairy herd of 43 {Friesian}cows is kept.The cows are all named e.g.Georgian, Toots etc. The farmer built his own milking parlour.It contains 3 machines which take 2 hours to milk 6 cows at a time.The capital investment is not now giving the return expected.This farmer could produce more milk but is restricted by E.E.C.quotas.Small farms are allowed the same as 1983 but large farms' quotas are reduced by 10%. The farm is on the flight path of low level training aircraft. On Elliot's Hill opposite the Hall there is an oak tree planted on { {June 7th.1977}to commemorate the Silver Jubilee of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II.The hill is also of interest because plants unique to the area grow here.They are lobaria pulmonaria and teloschistes flavicans.
